intro: Elytraria planifolia subsp. planifolia, commonly known as the flat-leaf elytraria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family, and is characterized by its narrow, flat leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and forest margins. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences with tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
